reviewText:
YES!!! This game is a most definite 4 thumbs up! If you love strategy and have always wanted to test your skills then here is the PERFECT game for you! There's so many campaigns and each one for each faction is differernt in its own way. Also, each faction has a few perks that none of the others have; for instamce: English, Longbowmen; French, Courageous Knights; HRE (Holy Roman Empire), has average everything; so on and so forth. There's so many different factions that if I wrote down all their strengths and weaknesses it would take me about an hour to do so! And even on the lowest graphics setting it still doesn't look half bad. It also has historical battles like Agincourt, Hastings, I think it has Stamford Bridge but not for sure. Please don't hesitate to buy it because of the price its well worth it! (in fact, i bought it for $5 while it was on sale :D) I hope to see you on guys!
Please play this game guys you'd love it especially if you download the Kingdoms DLC whick isn't needed or anything but it adds a lot more campaigns to be played.

Also, this game alerts you to events that are happening in the world (like the Black Plague or the Mongolian invasion). Thus forcing you to respond to the changes in your environment by either building more defensive structures and training more troops in one area or maneuvering soldiers to another position. I absolutely love this game it is one of my all-time favorites.

reviewText: Medieval 2: Total War is one of the best games from the Total War series. The game itself is really in-depth, and the strategy is so immersive and complex. Even the campaign map has hidden strategies for managing the diplomacy of your kingdom, which makes the seemingly uncalled for attacks from neighboring nations look a lot less random. The battlefields and units are designed very well and the whole game looks very polished. Battle strategies can be somewhat complex, but once you get the hang of them you will feel like a 5 star general. Not to mention the fact that you can even modify the game to play as the papal states, which has influence over most European factions. I haven't tried any big mods for this game yet, but I've heard about many of them, so it's nice to know that there are options out there in the unlikely event that I ever get bored with the main game. If you're looking to buy anything on Steam, this is a game you should seriously consider adding to your library. Happy warmongering!

reviewText:
Basically, the best Total War game out there. I've been a total war fan for a looong time. Played pretty much every total war except Attlia. The Worst? Probably Rome 2, Empire (due to bugs, not a bad concept). Best? Rome 1, Medieval 2, Shogun 1+2 (Shogun, only consistent series)

Whats good about M2TW?

Graphics: Not bad, in fact really good for it's time
Replayability: I played M2TW, then played the Kingdoms expansions (4 campaigns in ONE DLC, WOOW)

And any issues? All solved by mods. The modding community for M2TW was superior compared to any other game, as you can see from mods like Third Age.

I have Third Age 3.2, a Lord Of The Rings based total war based of J.R.R Tolkien's universe containing elements and lore from the books, and some images and content from the films. It also has a Middle-Earth map, custom units, and in some ways actually an improvement on M2TW. I also have the MOS 1.6.2 submod installed, which fixes many issues, changes/improves the original mod, and allows A LOT of customizing for the game.

Seperately I have the Westeros Total War 0.53 Alpha mod installed. This one is obviously unfinished, but it's modding team are still active and continue to improve it. This mod is based on George R Martin's book series 'A Song of Ice and Fire'. My submod for this is the Game of Thrones submod, which adds images and player models and other things from the HBO TV series, which I follow rather than the books (Im lazy :/ )

So yeah, with this package i have access to Medieval II Total War with 4 extra themes (Americas, Crusades, Britiannia and Teutonic), Third Age Total War and Westeros Total War. So if you like stratergy games, or any other total war games, truust me, with this game potential playtime is INFINTE!

reviewText:
I love this beauty of a game. I have spent a lot of time conquering the French, The Holy Roman Empire and Spain as England. Although I have yet to have an army of Dismounted English Knights, or Armoured Swordsmen legitimatly, I have only got up to a few of each in an army. There are countless mods for this game, making it even better. My favorites are Rage of Dark Gods, which takes place in the Warhammer universe. Another is Third Age, a Lord of the Rings mod. They are both great mods. I have spent countless hours on this game. Even though it says '99 Hours Played.' Thats a lie. I have played 200 hours easily in this game. Even when you have no internet, this game CAN be played. One of my go to games if we have no internet. Some Pros and Cons
Pros:
- You get to have your own army
- You are a king of an empire, many to choose from
- Not laggy at all, even with a good computer
- Very challenging, I consider this a good thing
- Historical Characters in game
- Historical Battles you can play
- You get to play in custom battles, with OP(Over Powered) units.
- 5 types of mods w/ Kingdoms expansion. (As of now, I think it comes just with base game.) Base Game, Americas, Crusades, Brittania, and Teutonic.
Cons:
- Bad Graphics (Im a texture kinda guy.)
- Tends to bug out sometimes, its an old game.
- Other Kingdoms may have an advantage over you in early game depending on their Pros and Cons (Says when you got to pick a kingdom)

Overall, this game is really good. I love it so much, it would definetly recommend you get it right away. Although I have yet to play with my friends, its still fun playing by yourself.

reviewText:
I love this game, Medieval 2 Total War in my opinion is the best Total War game to date, Rome Total War polished, and I enjoy the medieval era more than the Roman era. Objectively speaking there is an undeniable quantity of value in this game, before I downloaded mods I had about 200 hours. The vanilla version of this game is excellent. I could even play the campaign mode of the vanilla version after playing the campaign mode of these mods. Battles in this game are the best it will ever be and with multiple medieval eras from early to high to late where you have musket men and cannons. I could have an army of Mongolian cavalry fight an army of French pikemen and musket men. Possibilities in the battles are endless! Also, battles require tactical positioning, flanking, planning and using your brain in general. If you don’t like to use your brain, than don’t buy this game. If you do, however, you will find very interesting and creative ways to defeat your enemies. When to attack the enemy or hold position and send spearmen to the front, when you should retreat or hold fast. There is just so much fun to have in battles.
The Campaign mode has no story, like every other Total War game, based on the situation of your nation and other nations, plans and ambitions, you make your own story. Be the king of England and defeat the French once and for all, forge an empire of 2 land masses. Play as Byzantium and retake lost lands and lost lands of the Roman empire. When it comes to recruitment and construction it is balanced. Recruitment pools determine how many units you can recruit per turn and how long you must wait until you can recruit another one of the same unit. This prevents large and massive armies of heavy infantry running all over the place. Diplomacy feels real as in the medieval times there were no phones to call other leaders. Countries had to send a diplomat and wait for a response. Diplomacy is not as in depth as it could be, but this game is focused around war and military. Keep that in mind when you play the campaign mode. Trade, alliances, embargos, vassals, military access, the basics are all there. Events happen in the campaign mode throughout such as the Mongolian invasion, the discovery of gunpowder and the new world, and yes, this game includes the plague.
Overall, unless you are too stupid to use your brain in coordination and deep thought, you will enjoy this game and get your money’s worth without a doubt. Even at full retail price I would still find my money’s worth. Go buy it on sale if you are still sceptical, I did it, too.
I give this game a full 10/10!

reviewText:
One of the best strategy games I have ever played! If you are a fan of strategy and you didn't play this,you miss on a lot.

Even if this is a pretty old game as of this review,it still feels relevant.I love almost everything about it.

It has everything you would want from a medieval strategy game.You are the ruler of your country.You can amass armies and take cities and destroy empires or you can settle down and build your economy.

The RTS(Real Time Strategy) part of it is really well done.It feels so good to control huge armies and move them across the battlefield.The game has archers,cavalry,heavy infantry,siege weapons and a lot more units that you can combine and create a formidable force.

The TBS(Turn Based Strategy) part of it is also rewarding and fun.It handles religion and trading pretty well but I feel like the diplomacy is lacking.The AI is pretty good but it feels like everyone is your enemy even if you are allied to them.At the first chance they will backstab you,that is a flaw in my opinion.You can choose to either fight your battles or auto-resolve them.Auto-resolving them is pretty good and it won't screw you over if you do now have the time to fight your battles.

This game has a lot of very good mods which enhance the game in every possible way so if you find the game appealing without the mods you'll enjoy it even more with the mods.
